intro: Mezzettia havilandii, commonly known as the Haviland's mezzettia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are white to pale pink in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
